text: I did my mandatory extent of two years
and management consulting many of my
classmates went either into management
consulting or finance spent one year at
a smaller firm and for the past 22 years
I've been an entrepreneur with a small
business three years ago I founded a
nonprofit that I feel very passionately
passionately about it's a nonprofit that
has the mission of protecting what we
call critical infrastructure that's
things like the electric grid
communication systems water and
sanitation systems against natural and
man-made disasters I've gotten as much
reward from that as I actually have in
my own business I think that in a way
almost everybody who attends harvard
business school is very privileged and
at some point you want to give back to
both of your society and in a sense to
the world so you look for ways to do
that also I think that many of us are
fortunate in that we can develop a
foundation of professional foundation
which does allow us some flexibility in
later years to pursue some of these more
altruistic or nonprofit interests
